page.title: 15Local History
page.content: There are several ideas as to the derivatives of the name Rainford. One is that the first part is part of an Old English name Regna. Thus Regna's ford. Some suggest is derived from Anglo-Saxon word "Rand" Recent discoveries have however given a new perspective. A family named Rainford originated from Randers Fjiord in Denmark and came to England in 1066. The similarity of names Randers Fjiord and Rainford drew people to the conclusion that when the family obtained land in Lancashire they called it after the family name. In the Nineteenth Century large changes took place due to the industrial revolution. Agriculture prospered, aided by farming methods and in the indutrial parts of the area employment was provided by the clay pipe and coal mining industries.
